026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns;
027
028import com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator;
029import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
030import com.ibm.streams.operator.OutputTuple;
031import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamSchema;
032import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingInput;
033import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingOutput;
034import com.ibm.streams.operator.Tuple;
035import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.InputPortSet;
036import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.InputPorts;
037import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.OutputPortSet;
038import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.OutputPortSet.WindowPunctuationOutputMode;
039import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.OutputPorts;
040
041/**
042 * Abstract pattern class for an operator that receives a tuple and then
043 * optionally submits a tuple. This pattern supports a number of input streams
044 * and a single output stream. A sub-class provides optional filtering and
045 * transformation.
046 */
047@InputPorts(@InputPortSet)
048@OutputPorts(@OutputPortSet(cardinality=1,windowPunctuationOutputMode=WindowPunctuationOutputMode.Preserving))
049public abstract class TupleInTupleOut extends AbstractOperator {
050
051    /**
052     * Initialize this operator. Called once before any tuples are processed.
053     * Sub-classes must call super.initialize(context) to correctly setup an
054     * operator.
055     */
056    @Override
057    public void initialize(OperatorContext context) throws Exception {
058        super.initialize(context);
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Get the output schema for the single output port.
063     */
064    public final StreamSchema getOutputSchema() {
065        return getOutput().getStreamSchema();
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Get the single output.
070     */
071    public final StreamingOutput<OutputTuple> getOutput() {
072        return getOutput(0);
073    }
074
075    /**
076     * Called when a tuple is received on the input port. First filter() is
077     * called on the incoming tuple, if that returns true transform() will be
078     * called otherwise no further action is taken.
079     */
080    @Override
081    public final void process(StreamingInput<Tuple> inputStream, Tuple tuple)
082            throws Exception {
083
084        if (!filter(inputStream, tuple))
085            return;
086
087        StreamingOutput<OutputTuple> outStream = getOutput();
088
089        OutputTuple outTuple = outStream.newTuple();
090
091        if (transform(inputStream, tuple, outTuple))
092            outStream.submit(outTuple);
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Perform any filtering rules on the incoming tuple. This implementation
097     * returns true. <BR>
098     * Sub-classes override this method to provide specific filtering.
099     * 
100     * @param inputStream
101     * @param tuple
102     * @return True to continue processing this tuple and call transform, false
103     *         to stop processing this tuple and do not send any output tuples.
104     */
105    protected boolean filter(StreamingInput<Tuple> inputStream, Tuple tuple) {
106        return true;
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * Perform any required transformation.
111     * 
112     * @param inputStream
113     * @param tuple
114     *            Incoming tuple.
115     * @param outTuple
116     *            An empty tuple.
117     * @return True to send outTuple, false to not send the tuple.
118     * @throws Exception
119     */
120    protected abstract boolean transform(StreamingInput<Tuple> inputStream,
121            Tuple tuple, OutputTuple outTuple) throws Exception;
122}
